result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah L Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school and treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation
any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
*Court ordered condition time of 90 days in the House of Correction, same release privileges as above.  No good time.  Report in date stayed to 11-14-14, 12:00 p.m.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain GED or HSED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Pay restitution to Krista T. in an amount be determined at restitution hearing.  If not paid within term of probation, a civil judgment to be entered.
*No contact with Krista T. and her place of employment, or Jacorey (last name unknown).
- Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
  Court WAIVED the mandatory DNA surcharge, as this case is a misdemeanor and no DNA sample will be taken.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work, school and treatment

records.addlTxt: Letter to DOC-Cashier's Office.
Letter from DOC Cashier's office re: DNA surcharge, received and filed.
Amended per restitution being set at zero.
Per restitution being set at zero.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  On motion of the State, court ordered restitution set at zero ($0).

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Jeremiah L Hudson not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Griffin).  Defendant not produced.  Victim shall be allowed to re-apply for Crime Victim Compensation.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Jeremiah L Hudson not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Defendant
Sentencing Referral Form
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jeremiah L Hudson in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Addional statement by Krista T.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:

*Court ordered condition time of 90 days in the House of Correction, same release privileges as above.  No good time.  Report in date stayed to 11-14-14, 12:00 p.m.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain GED or HSED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Pay restitution to Krista T. in an amount be determined at restitution hearing.  If not paid within term of probation, a civil judgment to be entered.
*No contact with Krista T. and her place of employment, or Jacorey (last name unknown).


- Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
  Court WAIVED the mandatory DNA surcharge, as this case is a misdemeanor and no DNA sample will be taken.  

Appeal rights given.  Court denied defendant's request for expungement.  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Per Chief Judge Directive 06-01A, this case is reassigned to Judge       for Reconfinement Review Hearing.  Reconfinement Review from the Department of Corrections, filed.  mjs  Per Chief Judge Directive 06-01A, this case is reassigned to Judge       for Reconfinement Review Hearing.  Reconfinement Review from the Department of Corrections, filed.  mjs  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Per Chief Judge Directive 06-01A, this case is reassigned to Judge       for Reconfinement Review Hearing.  Reconfinement Review from the Department of Corrections, filed.  mjs

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Jeremiah L Hudson in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Griffin).  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Theft (value not exceeding $2,500.00), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah L Hudson in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Sara N Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Krista T.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeremiah L Hudson in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Jeremiah L Hudson in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
